Reviews.Title: “Good location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: bigtwinky
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, but ok per NYC standards. Staff was friendly. Our TV didnt work, they had someone up to fix it quick. Location is nice. Walk to Brooklyn bridge a few blocks from the subway. Not much to do around the hotel, but it is the financial district

Reviews.Title: “Beware to Priceline Customers”
Reviews.Author: LeonMart
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and got a discounted rate which was about $40.00 per night cheaper than the rack rate. On the hotel's website, for the nights I chose to stay, a king room and two doubles were the same price. After booking the room, I called the hotel to request a room with 2 beds and I was advised if a room with 2 double beds were available I would be able to get one. When I arrived to check in, a room with 2 doubles was available, however, I was informed there would be a $40.00 + tax upcharge despite the fact that the rack rate was the same for 2 doubles or one king. I advised the desk clerk that when I called no one told me there would be an upcharge. He told me that my request was in his notes, but there was still an upcharge. I ended up getting a roll away that after tax for 3 nights cost an extra $89.00. The 2 doubles upcharge would have been close to $150.00 extra. Aside from the hotel gouging me, it was clean but the free breakfast was substandard. The breakfast room is difficult to navigate because it is small and has these ridiculous oversized chairs. Because it is very small, the lobby is not much larger than a standard size hotel room and usually has one desk clerk working. Be prepared for a wait upon check in or if you need to store your luggage. The rooms are small even by NYC standards and the elevators were extremely slow. The location is good for business in the financial district and access to Battery Park, but is quite a subway or cab ride from midtown or other attractions. With a rack rate in the low $200's I would stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super value”
Reviews.Author: Sand088
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in January during a business trip. For the money, this is a great location - close to the financial district. Rooms are small but why go to NYC if you are going to stay in your room. Served it's purpose well. Has a free breakfast in the am, something more than continental but not made to order. If you want to see the sites and this is not strictly a business trip, try uptown. It will be more expensive though. If you have no problem with the subway system and are on a limited budget, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Kenny K
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on the weekend of March 3, 2012. Good location, steps to subway, Wall St, Battery Park, Chinatown, ground 0 etc. Breakfast included. 24hours drug store across the street. We got a room with sofa bed. My kid loved it. Room has fridge & microwave. Very clean, OK size,OK breakfast . modern setting. Friendly staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in New York”
Reviews.Author: Lakeview5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our first visit to New York City and planned on hitting all of the tourist sights. We found this hotel to be a reasonable price as well as a great location in the financial district. We were able to walk to many sights and were close to the subway station in order to travel to all of the others. The hotel itself was clean and neat. The entrance was a bit hard to locate with it being on a city street and a narrow building. This being said, the room was small but adequate, clean and well appointed. We could control the room temperature from a thermostat on the wall. We turned the fan portion to on during the night and heard no noise from the other rooms. We had a small amount of street noise and were located on the 8th floor. Since we spent most of our time out and about we found the room to meet our needs. The breakfast offered the following items - juices, bacon, eggs, sausage gravy, biscuits, muffins(not worth eating), bagles, bread, cinnamon rolls, cereal, coffee, yogurt, milk, bananas, and pancakes (but the machine was broken the entire time we were there). We were lacking a bath towel and called down the the front desk to request one. Someone quickly delivered it and then a short time later, the front desk called to make sure we had received it. All in all a great place to stay during your New York trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, was pleasantly surprised.....”
Reviews.Author: copleycop
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Intercontinental Times Sq & Staybridge Suites Times Sq before and have seen this hotel on our travels, so thought we'd give it a try for cheaper prices as we like the wall street location, expecting things not to be as good as we've had before even though I'm a platinum member and sometimes get better upgrades at the premium hotels. Actually it was great if not better than the others. What made it was the hotel staff especially Sonia in the breakfast room who were so friendly and kind and made the stay memorable. I stay with the intercontinental hotel group a lot and this is what is missing from most of their other medium / high end hotels. We got a high floor room with a great view and a welcome gift, which was nice. Yes the hotels rooms are small, but it's New York but the internal decor is good and better than most holiday inn express across UK and Europe. For the money this hotel is a sound choice for New York area - please give it a try. We'll be returning when we can.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value if you're on a budget and want to stay in Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: Karen E
Reviews.Content: Lobby small and entrance a little hard to find. Don't let the wall st. area deter you, in is very convenient. I got a great rate, the room is cramped but clean. You're near all the trains and there are a lot of nice places to eat and hang out in the neighborhood. I'm from NYC, so to be able to visit for a few days without breaking the bank is great. I was surprised how much I liked staying in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Worst NYC I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderDelarge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in dozens of hotels in NYC. This hotel stay was a complete joke. The tiny room smelled of wet carpet, the toilet did not work, there was no hot water, the breakfast was poor, the lone elevator took 5-10 minutes to get you from the lobby to your floor.....The location is remote and does not offer many dining choices in the area. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great smaller quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: coby3
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent value for money. I took an extended weekend break and booked this at an amazingly low rate for Manhattan. The room wasn't large, but clean and well supplied with amenities. Only a few rooms per tiny floors in a tall building ensured it was a quiet stay. Also, you get almost no traffic in that area at night, so it's easy to sleep. The bathroom is very clean, nicely maintained and supplied. There's a complementary breakfast which is not the healthiest, but a reasonable choice of food and well cooked. The breakfast area may get a little busy towards the end of the breakfast hours. Wall St. is litreally a corner away, the hotel is well connected by metro and you can easily go for a walk along the lower East side with nice piers and strolling areas. A great choice for city breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Improved service”
Reviews.Author: vFNG
Reviews.Content: Returned here in January and received excellent service from front desk. Thanks for responding to concerns. Always excellent location and breakfast server Sonia.

Reviews.Title: “I love Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: mcwcBaku
Reviews.Content: Somehow they just hit-the-spot with me. Everything I need (breakfast, wifi, iron and ironing board, comfortable bed and pillows, plenty of TV choice) plus what I like (helpful staff) with nothing extra. No muss no fuss, just comfortable and affordable place to stay when I like. The only complaint I have is the noisy heating/cooling system (well, the rooms in New York at least are pretty cramped, too).

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Blastandlaugh
Reviews.Content: Been to NYC dozens of times and this hotel was the worst by far. It had typical small rooms like many hotels in NYC. The breakfast was less than desireable. The room had a leak which caused the carpet to remain damp the entire stay. There was a mold issue with the AC unit which caused the room to have a foul odor. Lastly the location is not that great if you like to go out and dine. I do not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I'm Not Sure How to Rate It.”
Reviews.Author: NWOhioGuy
Reviews.Content: This is a HI Express offering fairly standard amenities right off Wall Street in the Financial District. I'll give you the highs and lows I saw and let you decide: Lows: 1. Bad smell in elevators, 2. A little shabby, including ripped bed skirts, 3; Tiny rooms, 4. Items still in room from previous occupant, and 5. Breakfast room so crowded with furniture it is difficult to navigate. Highs: 1. Attractive price, 2. Helpful front desk staff, 3. The room was bug-free and reasonable clean, and 4. The property is close to the subways to go uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sevilla90
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while Christmas shopping & visiting friends. The accommodations were very comfortable & clean. The staff was super friendly & the breakfast was very good. The hotel also offers luggage storage if you plan on staying past your check out time. We were upgraded to a "junior suite" for free which was lovely. A super close walk to the South Seaport shops/NYC Water taxi & great view of Brooklyn Bridge. Fairly easy to hail cabs from out front too, & the subway is 1 block away. We totally would stay there again. Advice: do not park on the same street as it is a total sham i.e. NYC. Park a few blocks up on Meridian & save yourself some spending money. <<< not related to HIE, but wanted to comment for the travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, clean and affordable for NYC”
Reviews.Author: sam86228
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that my family has stayed at this Holiday Inn Express and I again found the hotel to be a great value. The location is a more quiet area of the city but very close to all subway lines and walking distance from the Brooklyn Bridge. Our rooms were clean, well maintained and quiet. The breakfast staff member was very pleasant and kept the buffet stocked, but there are also many food choices on the surrounding blocks if one doesn't want the ususal HIE fare - try the Crumbs Bakery just a block away for great cupcakes/ wonderful coffees. The rooms are small - best for max of 2 people- but on par with other hotels that charge such a reasonable rate in this city. Not all rooms have a bathtub so ask during your reservation if you want one. The hotel is completely nonsmoking which I greatly appreciate. Very near the Museum of Finance, the Staten Island Ferry and Battery Park and the Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and noisey”
Reviews.Author: Magnet50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past, but this last trip was my last. When I made the reservation (2 months prior to travel), the stated rate was on par with similar hotels in the area and I didn't think about it too much. However, on my first night, they slipped a bill under my door intended for the next room, and it was significantly cheaper. Then, a co-worker, who made the reservation a few days before his stay, told me he got the cheaper rate. On checking out (after a mostly sleepless night, for reasons that I will discuss next), I very politely asked the manager to adjust my bill, pointing out the difference in rate and the proximity to our office, with the potential for increased stays. She refused without comment. Ok, so the rooms are small and the bathrooms are so small that it can be difficult to move around without bumping into things. And the proximity to Water Street and Wall Street means that it is noisey at night. Very noisey. Traffic noises, garbage trucks, etc. On a positive side, the breakfast, such as it is, is free. Due to the small hallways, I would not recommend this for people who use wheelchairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good place near Wall Street”
Reviews.Author: kentgrad
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay here for business and your travels are going to keep you near the New York stock exchange, this is a very good choice. The rooms are average- for New York standards- and the breakfast is nice. The staff is very friendly- not your typical New Yorker at all- and the breakfast staff is super nice! Don't expect to get any type of a view of any of the New York famous landmarks. That being said, there are 2 subway lines that are very close that will get you anywhere. Battery park is walkable as well. The ride to Time Square was a bit longer and had me on the subway much longer than I wanted, but I think the New York Subway system is one of the most disgusting creations every made by man. There is little to no night life around this hotel and you will most likely have to travel to get a dinner. There was a really nice quiet Irish-esque type bar that served ok corned beef and they had Guinness on draft.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly staff, safe location”
Reviews.Author: azmommyof2
Reviews.Content: I was scrambling for a hotel last minute in NYC & came across this "unknown" hotel on hotwire. It is located on wall street so it's a little further away from midtown, times square, etc. Walking distance to Ground Zero, Seaport restaurants, shops & more touristy spots. The room was very small but expected for NYC. Clean, no shared bathroom & very friendly staff. They have a "business center" where I was able to check emails, print tickets, etc. Open 24hrs. They did have a free breakfast that I didn't take advantage of but it smelled good. My sister thought it was quite noisy at night but I didn't hear a peep once asleep. It was good value for what I payed. Taxi's obviously very easy to grab from front of hotel....No gripes :)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Convenient, Safe”
Reviews.Author: eggplantlady
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express Wall Street is a small hotel in the financial district. It is a tall, narrow cube of a building, with 2 elevator shafts in the middle and only 5 rooms on each floor, therefore, the hallways are extremely quiet. Because of the positioning of the elevators, when you first enter the hotel, the front desk isn't immediately apparent. The staff is friendly but many of them are not effusive (I think some of this may be due to differences in language), but this is formally rated only 3 stars, so don't expect 5 star treatment. Personally, I give it an overall 4 star review. There is a 2 station computer room in the basement accessible by room key, which was clean and safe. There is a workout room with 3 large pieces of equipment nearby. Our room, #605 faced the courtyard which meant that our view consisted of the backs of 3 other buildings, however, this is one reason why I could actually sleep in NYC - no noise! The room was of European design meaning that it was extremely efficient in the use of space, and appeared to have been recently renovated. We had a king size bed with 2 generous end tables with 1 drawer and 1 shelf underneath of each. There was a medium size desk and chair in a slight alcove, and a medium size 4 drawer dresser next to a narrow closet. Much more room than was needed by 2 women for 5 days. The bathroom was fairly large but suffered the typical fate of only having one very, very small shelf for personal items. There was room for a full set of shelves or a set of drawers - they should update this. The only downside to the appearance was that during the renovation process they did not replace the bathroom tile, however it never appeared dirty, just a little worn. We got a rate of about $180/night before tax and when checking in asked if we could get 2 beds instead of the king. We were told that they would check and that it would be $25 per night extra. We kept the king and it was such a good bed that you never new anyone else was in there with you! The next day I overheard someone else ask the same question and they were told it would be an additional $45 per night for 2 beds, but the price difference may have been between a week night and a weekend rate. This was our first time staying in the financial district and it will be my first choice from now on. We spend most of our time in midtown and the travel back and forth couldn't have been easier. There were subway stops 2-3 blocks away and it was safe to walk after dark (at least until 10 or so, we weren't out later) as there was a strong police presence the whole way. There is a movement to grow this area residentially so there is a vested interest in making sure that it is safe. Avoid the new South Street Seaport tourist mall and stop at some of the small independent restaurants that are nearly empty on weekends, such as Ryan MaGuire's, what a meal! Note: if you call the front desk and ask for a cab, they will actually call a limo - be warned.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff - terrible for kids”
Reviews.Author: wepd
Reviews.Content: I had called the hotel prior to our arrival to inquire about getting two cribs to accommodate my twin sons, and was told that they would have them for us. So, I was only too happy to leave the pack n’ plays at home as we set out to fly on Thanksgiving morning. However, when we arrived at the hotel, we were cheerfully told that they had one crib, but not two. And try telling one toddler that they are sleeping in the crib while the other sleeps with mom and dad – disaster. To avert just that scenario, we asked (begged!) the hotel to figure something out – was anyone checking out who was using one, could they borrow from a sister property, anything! We even left two cell phone numbers with the desk when we went out for Thanksgiving dinner to call us if they were unable to find another crib so that we could find somewhere to buy a portable crib. No call … and yup, you guessed it – no cribs. It was an awful night for us … and everyone around us. The next day I finally called the ICH main number and was able to speak with someone who seemed to understand out plight ... and lo and behold, within an hour I had a call from the front desk that our second crib would be delivered momentarily. It’s pathetic that it took a call to “corporate” to make something happen … but at least it did. However, in one final moment of unpleasantness, the clerks who checked me out – Irene and Matthew (the front desk manager who had been downright obsequious the day before when informing me of the newly-available crib) – were overheard in clear earshot of other guests laughing at us and making fun of our situation. Nice. So, for a hotel chain that claims “Recharge, Reward, Respect”, its employees managed in the course of 48 hours to deprive my child of a bed and mock our family on our way out. Sounds to me like they have some work to do on that “Respect” point. Aside from the crib disaster, the rooms are incredibly small – not entirely unexpected in NYC, but as a frequent traveler, this was the smallest I’ve ever had. The second crib – as welcome as it was – went in the bathroom. But the location is decent (very close to family in our case), so we could definitely have coped with the room size were it not for the sleeplessness that went along with it. And the breakfast is a mob-scene to the point of being unusable. But the people are very nice in the deli next door!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and comfy...”
Reviews.Author: SylmarTravelers
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great little hotel. Hotels in NYC are notoriously small and expensive. Our room was small but we were comfortable. If you've never stayed in the city before then you really need to manage your expectations about the size of the room. We had 3 people in a room with 1 king bed and a pull out twin bed. It was tight but we managed. The bathroom had a nice counter where we could lay out all our stuff. Overall we were really happy with our room. It was clean and comfortable. The location was perfect for us. If you stay here don't miss the South Street Seaport just a couple of blocks away. You can walk to all the financial district sites and the rebuilding of the World Trade Center. Within a couple of blocks you can catch the subway to anywhere. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Faithl789
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11/24-11/27. The rooms are small. The woman at breakfast the first 2 mornings was great. They didn't get their delivery of food on Saturday, 11/27 so had only eggs...no bread products at all. Ok, things happen but why not run out to the store and get some bread or to DK to get donuts. Not happy about this as when we booked this hotel it was because of the breakfast being included. The other 2 mornings the food was ok but no fruit. The location is a short walk to the Pier where there are the NYC cruise line, water taxi, cute shops, a 'mall' and the Body Exhibition. The subway is also very close...unfortunately on Saturday the Wall St. subway entrance was closed and we couldn't find the right train and ended up in a cab. The location was quiet and peaceful. It was nice to get back to the hotel after the crowds uptown. It may have been quieter in Wall Street area due to the Thanksgiving holiday. Other comments mentioned the elevator wait. At the longest we had about a minute wait so am not sure what happened with other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodations but crappy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dapfunk187
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room at the Holiday Inn Express using priceline.com so we certainly can't complain about the price. Overall, the room was clean, but the bathroom was a bit small. I also found it odd that the coffee pot was in the bathroom - kinda gross, but at least there was coffee. The service was friendly as well. The biggest disappointment was the breakfast - it was swamped with people and the room is certainly not big enough to accommodate the crowds. The coffee had a burnt taste to it and the food was stale. The rooms come with free breakfast so I guess I shouldn't have extremely high expectations but at the very least expected decent coffee. I'd stay here again due to the convenient location, cleanliness and friendly staff, but would just make coffee in the room and go out to eat for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JamieEighteen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in early October 11. Arrived late (around 11:30pm) courtesy of some truly ridiculous queues for immigration at JFK. Greeted by the friendly night staff and given a little bag with some water, biscuits, maps etc as Platinum recognition. Two signatures later and I was on my way to the 23rd floor. Rooms are small but perfectly adequate and nicely furnished, including LCD TV's. The hotel is relatively new and that shows - physical condition was good throughout. Breakfast is HI Express standard - nothing spectacular but fills a gap. Nice cinnamon rolls though... Location wise it is in the business district but is close to several subway stations and the Staten Island Ferry. It doesn't take too long to get uptown to Times Square, Central Park and the like. Given that I paid the equivalent of $90 in points per night it was excellent value by New York standards. In short I would happily stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, poor service, no comfort and smelly rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Karenspade27
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for business and after checking in to my first room I was overcome with a very musty smell. I went down to the front desk and asked to be moved. Second room was 68 degrees and freezing...couldn't get the temperature to change so I called downstairs and asked to be moved. They said someone would come up in twenty minutes to check the thermostat. I went downstairs and asked for the manager because I didn't want to sit in the room freezing and waiting for someone to fix the thermostat. Moved to a third room and although it smelled musty again I just decided to get some sleep. Woke at night and stepped out of bed into a puddle of water from the heat/ac unit that was on the wall. Realized that was the musty smell. Called to complain and a the phone was answered by house keeping who said all of the staff was in a meeting and there was nobody to help me. I called the corporate office who said they can not refund the full amount of a stay. If you have allergies this is not the hotel for you. The breakfast was horrible...so bad I didn't even eat it. Also the elevators are so slow you need an extra 15 minutes in the morning to get yourself downstairs. There are plenty of others in the area that are much nicer for the money. I never review hotels but this was one of the worst I have stayed in for comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & small but met our need. I'd go back if the price was right.”
Reviews.Author: pedromichael
Reviews.Content: We stayed October 20-23 Our QUEEN room was very small even for NY standards and compared to other HI Express locations in NYC. The room however, had that "NEW REFRESHED" feeling and was extremely clean including the carpet. I actually was not afraid to take off my flip flops to shower! The bed was comfortable and the temperature control maintained a comfortable temperature. They really maximized space in this hotel. The flat TV was wall mounted. There was a small chest of 4 drawers instead of a vanity. The desk and space saving chair was crammed in one corner and the bed in the other. There was even a small nightstand. The closet had a small shelf on top and was located behind the entrance door. We arrived at 11pm and woke at 7 so only spent 8 hrs sleeping so the room served its purpose. The bathroom in the room we stayed in was not that small but it was very poorly layed out. People have posted pics of the restrooms but ours was like the one posted labeled " Room at Holiday Inn Express Wall St" Take a look for yourselves. There are 2 different types. In our unfunctional bathroom the door opened up right onto the toilet. Also the counter was curved and since the toilet was located so close to the curve of the counter it was just very uncomfortable and we are not big people. All they have to do is move the toilet over a few inches towards the tub which is possible. Didn't anyone from the hotel or holiday inn express check out guest comfort??? There was an exercise room in the basement and a Business center as well with 2 computers and printer. But beware you can not download anything to the computer or upload photos to the computer as the security on the computer does not allow this. The really is no lobby in this hotel. Just a couch across the front desk and 2 chairs by the elevator. They lock the breakfast room after breakfast so you can't bring food back and eat it there. Check in was super fast and efficient. I called the hotel 2 days before arrival and they gave me accurate info. The nearest train station is "WALL STREET" on the 2/3 subway line. But there are many other lines if you walk an extra block or 2. I actually walked right past the hotel on Water street and called the hotel and they told me its right across the street from VERIZON which was true. All employees I talked to on the phone were patient. The young ladies in the breakfast area were nice and kept everything full. The maids were good as well. Each day they made the bed and replaced ALL tioletries. My room contained 2 bars of soap, shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, shower cap, coffee, tea, decaff, decaff tea, cups, ice bucket w/ liners, towels, mats, washcloths. Ice machine was on the 17th floor. The only thing I noticed that this hotel did not have was 24hr coffee/tea in the lobby. Other HI expresses serve this but they did not. I know they have it in the room but sometimes you are just lazy and want to grab and run. We unfortunately had to leave on Sat. because the hotel really upped the room price on Saturday so we switched to Candlewood for the last 2 days. I couldn't understand why because the hotel was not at all that full while we were there. The neighborhood was fine. Safe to walk in after dark. No "iffy" characters walking around unlike the HI express on 39th st, that has a less than to be desired location. Would I go back.........OF COURSE if the price is right!!! It met out needs and was clean!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Water Street”
Reviews.Author: blroe
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Manhatten and stayed in Holiday Inn Express New York City-Wall Street. This hotel is centrally located close to Wall street subway station. Room was very small as can be expected but are clean. Bathroom very basic with shower only.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: amitchella
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel frequently as our company is headquartered nearby. The location is perfect and gives you great access to most parts of the city. The value is good as well, especially knowing that NY prices are typically out the roof for most rooms. The rooms are very basic, functional and clean. Free wi-fi is included. Although there is breakfast included, it may or may not suit you depending on your tastes. I would have no problem staying here during a personal visit to NY as well. Be sure to visit Pearl Street at night!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Magnet50
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during the week of September 5th while attending a training class at my company's office on Wall Street, so it is certainly convienant. I called my wife and told her that I was in the world's smallest suite and while it is small, it's roomy enough. For one. The room had a small desk, a cabinet that contained a (small) microwave and 'fridge, a small amoire for hanging clothes that also held the ironing board and iron. The hangers provided had clips for men's trousers, but the rod holding the hangers was too low and the trousers would drag on the bottom. The bed was large and comfortable and the lighting was adequate for reading. The bathroom was typically small and really tight but that's something I think I just need to get used to in NYC as that seems to be the case for all of the lower cost hotels (by which I mean around $200 - $250 a night). And, typically, the corridors were very tight. The rooms were serviced nicely - with towels and bedding changed regularly. My room faced Water Street and it was fairly quiet. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby. A Subway right next door and the Water Street Cafe (a deli and buffet) at the end of the block for budget-minded visitors and a number of more expensive restaurants within easy walking distance. Of course, there are food carts at the intersection of Wall and Water Streets that offer great food at low prices. The internet was free, fast and mostly stable. Two elevators handle all 20+ floors, but I never had a really long wait (only 4 or 5 rooms to a floor). They have free breakfast that includes eggs and bacon and suprisingly good coffee. The woman who handled the breakfast area was especially cheerful and nice. You can easily walk to the World Trade Center site and, for a little longer walk, take a stroll under the Brooklyn Bridge and continue to Chinatown and Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mbush1
Reviews.Content: A tiny sliver of a hotel about 4 blocks from Wall St and the World Trade Center site. The room was stylish and not much bigger than the king size bed. Just four rooms per floor on 28 floors. Air conditioning was a bit noisy, but the room was spotless and the staff very friendly and helpful. No frills, but certainly comfortable enough for a night or two in the financial district. Steps from South Street Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, safe location”
Reviews.Author: vFNG
Reviews.Content: We consistently stay at this hotel for the past 2 years due to its safe location, solid service, clean rooms, nearby subways, and surrounding eateries and 24-hour pharmacies. But I was surprised at the erratic wi-fi service and couldn't get much response from the front desk. I was told the hotel could only provide wi-fi, but was not responsible for the slow speed. Actually, my laptop froze continually in the evening, and I had to wait until morning to successfully surf the web and my email. Sonia was helpful as always at breakfast, and the front desk stored our luggage after checkout until we left the city.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and ok”
Reviews.Author: SawtoothinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: rooms clean and functional, staff ok and location convenient for business, not a bad price for the location

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bellaserasmama
Reviews.Content: Great new place right at Wall St. and South Street Seaport. So much to do and things to see. The hotel was immaculate, modern and convenient. The only negative was the breakfast that is provided. It could use fresher food and more variety. Otherwise, we will be staying there again on future trips to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location for Business trips; not so much for fun!”
Reviews.Author: 7bharats
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express at Water St-Wall St is located in the financial district. If you are on a fun trip to NYC, you would be better off staying in Midtown rather than here. Quite a few eateries around, but all of them close at 10pm. So have your dinner plans accordingly. The room was a bit on the smaller side, but you cant expect more in Downtown Manhattan. The amenities were good; the internet worked great; the bath was decent. The room looked recently renovated and clean. The complimentary breakfast menu left a bit wanted. The service inside the cafeteria was not very welcoming. The front desk service was professional. Would definitely go there again (if on a business trip/got a real cheap deal)!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at Holiday Inn Express Wall Street”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTarmale
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here the weekend of July 30th, 2011. We booked this last minute because we got a great deal-a junior suite for $159 including breakfast. The room was big enough although not huge. We had a queen bed, (it was advertised as a king bed but was actually a queen), and a twin sofa bed. It was enough room for four people and super clean. There is also a 32 inch flat screen tv, refrigerator and microwave and we had a great view of the buildings around us. All in all we were very pleased. Sonya in the breakfast room worked very hard keeping the food coming out and making sure everyone was satisfied. The front desk personnel, with the exception of one woman who was not in a good mood, was fantastic. The subway is about two blocks up on Wall Street with the Seaport two blocks in the opposite direction. If you are looking for a clean, affordable and quiet hotel this is the one for you. However, if you are looking for the hustle and bustle of Times Square then you need to move uptown more. We however were very happy to have a relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GEW5
Reviews.Content: Travelling from Dublin it was great to have a friendly face when we arrived to check in. Rooms were small typical New York but it is only somewhere to sleep. Breakfast was excellent a hot buffet only the pancake machine was very temperamental and the assistant was loosing patience with us trying to get it fixed. Strongly recommend here to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: VaniaSantana
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this property. We arrived in the hotel a little while after check-in started and were very pleased to see there wasn't a line. The front desk staff was helpful and efficient. The room (on the 14th floor) was small, but that's New York we're talking about, so no complaints there. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The location is good: close to the subway and safe at night. Complimentary breakfast was also very good! Looking forward to staying here again next time I'm in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service and principles”
Reviews.Author: susanna_banan
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Holiday Inn through priceline. My friend called up the hotel directly, telling them that we had booked through priceline but requested 2 double beds instead of 1 king bed to share between all of us. The person at the hotel said that we could have the 2 double beds without an additional fee. We thought great. We came to the hotel and checked in. When we walked in the room, we found that there was a king size bed instead of the 2 double beds. WTF?We went down to the check in desk and asked about the double beds that we were promised. The front desk said that it was never promised to us and that we'd have to incur a $45 addl fee to have the 2 double beds. My friend explained that he had called this hotel directly and talked to an employee who said there'd be no fee for replacing the king bed with 2 double beds. A supervisor came over and this was also explained to him. He said because we booked through priceline he cannot guarantee what they promise us. Which is a moot point, because my friend had called this Holiday Inn DIRECTLY and spoke to an employee. This supervisor didn't seem to understand that and kept saying deal with the third party (priceline), it's not our problem. You want the beds? Pay the fee. He gave us a complaint hot line to call. We called that line to talk about the issue we had. The rep on that line called the hotel to ask about the beds and the supervisor spoke to her and told her that he couldn't give us any. The rep at the complaint hot line relayed this back to us. We were so upset with this hotel location that we will never come back again.

Reviews.Title: “No soundproof walls”
Reviews.Author: 2005krish
Reviews.Content: A group of friends in the neighboring room were very noisy. In spite of complaint, no action was taken from the management. Sound proofing is very poor between the common walls. We had to bang the wall to stop the noise from the next room. We did not get sleep for the whole night. The hotel should refund the amount.

Reviews.Title: “Big Dissapointment, the property is what you expect the service is not”
Reviews.Author: StevenRM
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed @ the Holiday Inn Wall Street with my Fiance right after staying at the Chelsea Indigo and the Staybridge suites. At both those other hotels i received decent service but kept mentioning to my Fiance that Holiday Inn would be way better. I am a platinum priority club member & I travel alot for work at always stay at Holiday Inn Express and Holiday Inn they always treat me very kindly and go out of their way to make me happy. This is NOT the case in this hotel. On cleanliness, price, and location alone the hotel would receive a 3 the hotel is clean but going through construction which instantly dirties your suitcases, the price is great and by using points they are one of the cheapest hotels in Manhattan, and the location is not very great unless your day revolves around wall street and the Brooklyn bridge. Now for the service it was terrible I am a platinum card holder (the highest level) for the hotel and I dont believe i should be waited on hand and foot but I do believe I deserve to be treated respectfully. Let me start by saying there is i ONLY 1 great employee there and that is the woman in the complimentary breakfast section she is very kind and friendly. Everyone else could not make the time to be bothered. When i arrived for check in the girl behind the desk waited a couple seconds to attend to me since she was on her facebook then I was given a decent room. I wouldn't bother asking for upgrades or paying for the most expensive room all the rooms are pretty much the same with an uninspired view. The room is very small and the bathroom is even smaller I would not recommend this hotel to families but only solo travelers or couples on a budget. Since I am a platinum member I received a free "gift" bag that was made up of a bunch of flyers from local businesses, 2 waters, and a bag of cookies. Don't break the bank! Versus at staybridge i received gourmet chocolates, a bottle of wine, and a handwritten thank you card. At hotel indigo i received a credit for my room mini bar and a room upgrade. My first of many problems occurred when I did not receive information about how to log onto the internet I called down and the phone rang for awhile so I hang up called back a little later. Then second time I called back Carlos picked up promptly and gave me the information on the internet code. After seeing a mistake on my bill while looking online ($110 dollars for using my free night for "incidentals" even though with no mini bar or room service I don't know how this would be achieved) I called down spoke to Carlos where I was told he could not help I would have to wait for the manager in the morning. In our conversation I was told too calm down and let him speak even though I hadn't even explained the situation and was only talking for 5 seconds. I think he just didn't want to deal with me. In the morning I went over to the front desk to speak to the manager who was in the "back" I said I would wait. The person at the front desk continuously asked me whats wrong so that she could tell the manager I kept saying I would wait but finally told her the situation and she went to the "back" to speak to the manager. Seconds later she came back and said "Ok I'll take care of it" no I'm sorry, no were sorry for the inconvenience of charging you $110 on your vacation, nothing! Not even a visit from the manager. Finally, I went back to the room and then down to the business center at around 10AM. I first turned on the computer and had wait for it to start up, then it asked for a password to log in to the desktop that only the employees had. Luckily there was a phone in the center so i called over the front desk and they said they would send someone over. I waited 10 minutes and no one showed on my way up I saw a maintenance person who helped me turn on another computer than didn't need a log in. I began using the computer and another person came into to use the computer I told them it didn't work and that they would have to speak to someone. They too called the front desk and no one came. As i finished up I passed by the front desk to see that the person waiting for the computer was trying to explain the situation to the front desk person who not only didn't understand the situation but offered to change rooms, hilarious! Finally, I checked out, left the luggage with the front desk who leaves there bags at the front desk hours before actually putting it anywhere. I went around the city and at about 1pm I called over to the hotel and said I need a cab to take me and my family to Newark airport they said I had to call back and they would get me a rate. I personally think it would be more professional to call me back but oh well. I talked to the front desk a little later and they said it would be 100 dollars, plus toll, plus tip to get to the airport, which is way too much. In a cab alone the fair would be 80-90 bucks max with tolls & tip! How do i know this? Because I found a cab and this is what they charged. In fact last time I left from staybridge suites and got a limo the charge was $75 + tip! I'm very disappointed in that I feel some type of backdoor deal was made to charge me extra. Lastly, while I was holding a few bags from shopping I got my luggage on my way to the taxi waiting outside an African American gentleman at the front desk assisted me with my bags he pulled them out of the closet put them in front of me and walked away! Come on! Help me out! I understand your not the "bell boy" but give some type of decent service I would've tipped you! Overall getting a cheap stay is always good but spring for the extra money get the uptown experience and get decent to good service not horrible service. The staff did definitely needs to be trained correctly starting with the manager!

Reviews.Title: “Also okay for tourists even if it is more like a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merin81
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapes place we found to live in New York the week before independence day and overall we have very little to complain about. Even though it was a noisy aircon in the room, we had a fine sleep and it made a comfortable temperature. If you are a light sleeper, you may need to turn it off, but for us it was no problem. The hotel is good, even though the rooms are small compared to other places. But dont worry, you have enough space to mess around. The receptionists were helpful. Even though it is less a tourist hotel and more a business hotel, the staff were very helpful explaining how to see the fireworks on independence day. Cleaning was done every day, bathroom was fine, breakfast was good enough for us with a small selection of cereals, pancakes and bread. The area is good to stay in for a couple of days, but a if you stay more than a weekend, you must travel a bit to see things. It is close to the harbor with boats to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Staten Island, sailing cruises, water taxei, bike rental, Brookly bridge etc. and also the Hop on Hop off buses stop close by. It is ten minutes walk from the subway that easily takes you to Time Square and Central Park. It felt like it was a safe area. And yes, it is good internet connection. In the weekend it was more tourists at the hotel and in the weekdays it was more business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Guaranteed reservation not honored”
Reviews.Author: paulcoleman
Reviews.Content: In early May, 2011, I made a guaranteed reservation at Holiday Inn Express in the financial district. I selected that location because I had an early morning meeting in the financial district. After a transcontinental flight to JFK I arrived at the Holiday and was told they had no room for me. I was offered a room back at JFK, which I did not accept because of my early morning meeting. I found a convenient room on my own and was given $15 for my inconvenience. When my travel agent called the hotel the next morning she was told the reason there was not a room for me was because of one guest who refused to leave. This was clearly not true since there were two other people in the lobby with reservations but no room. I will never make a reservation at that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice little hotel in the Wall Street area. It is relatively close to subway stations (5-10 minute walk), and overall it is in a safe area. The rooms were of a fairly good size (by New York standards, not Holiday Inn Express standards) and were clean and comfortable. I think the hotel is fairly new. The breakfast was a standard Holiday Inn Express breakfast. We booked our room using points and overall felt it was a good value. We were not impressed with the service at the hotel, though. The front desk attendants were fine most of the time, but one of them was particularly rude. For example, we didn't have any shampoo in our room, went down to ask the front desk for shampoo, and she made us wait in the line of 10 people doing lengthy check outs even though she had the shampoo right in front of her. She also gave another guest confusing and unhelpful directions to the subway. Still, this wouldn't keep us from returning to the hotel. Overall, we do recommend it and definitely would stay there again if it was still available using our Priority Club points. For the actual price of the hotel as it was listed online I think you could find something comparable for less money. One piece of advice though--if you are taking a shared van from the airport (which is a horrible idea in the first place), they may have trouble finding the hotel. They tried to take me to the Holiday Inn Wall Street and told me it was the right place, which it of course wasn't. Apparently the mix-up happens a lot though.

Reviews.Title: “Five Boro Bike Ride”
Reviews.Author: Madison02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn Express Wall St, from 4/1 until 5/2 in one of the Jr. Suites. The room was big by NY standards. We were in New York for the largest bicycle ride in the U.S. the 5 Boro Bicycle ride on 5/1. We were able to keep our bikes in the room. Located just south of the Brooklyn Bridge we were able to bike easily to the bridge, There is a bicycle trail that from the Wall Street area around the to Hudson River and goes all the way up to the northern part of Manhattan, very nice trail with no walkers only bikes and skaters. The South Seaport has several nice places to eat and is home to several of the boat tours around NYC. You can catch the double decker tour buses there. The Wall Street Subway station is just a short walk up the hill. I always felt safe in the area. The World Trade Center is a 4-5 block walk. The staff members were very nice and helpful with area instructions. I would definitely stay at the Holiday Inn Express Wall Street Again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near Wall Street”
Reviews.Author: Cypris
Reviews.Content: This HI Express is new; the rooms are small but have all the amenities including frig, microwave, wi-fi, great bathroom fixtures. It's 2 blocks from the South Seaport (food court), close to the Brooklyn Bridge and the departing point to the Statue of Liberty.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean”
Reviews.Author: legsandalcohol
Reviews.Content: We were only there for two nights but this was a great no frills hotel. I booked through Priceline and after taxes, it came to $115/night which I think is decent for the location. I think the hotel was only a few months old so it was immaculately clean and shiny. The first room we got had no bathtub - I think it's for disabled people - but we asked to switch and they accommodated us. We got there really early in the morning and was hoping they'd let us check in early but no luck. I was kind of irked that they let these other people check in early. They did agree to take our luggage and give us access to the business centre though. There isn't much of a lobby to stay in. The breakfast was meh but I won't complain about free food. PROS: pretty convenient location clean quiet bed was comfortable CONS: tiny room with a tiny bathroom - no counter space! (but probably typical of NYC?) staff could be friendlier

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gwen_Indy
Reviews.Content: We went in March. I would not recommend this location or hotel. This is mostly a business district that is dead on the weekend. It is within close walking distance to the Statue of Liberty. If that is your desire, then you may like this location, but I would not choose this hotel. The room was very small(angled walls made it so the bed was only approachable from one side), the free breakfast was awful, and while our room was clean, most of the hotel was not.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located ... Apt for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: rkmadduri
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels across the US on my business travels. I liked this Holiday Inn is for its near perfect location in downtown Manhattan. It is very conveniently located to most of the offices in the Financial district. Every major office is a 5 to 10 min walk and is easy to go to Penn Station/Grand central or the city airports. For a business traveller there is Fedex Kinkos right across the road and some great places to grab a quick meal.(Au Bon Pain, Pret, Chipotle etc.) Easy to locate and very courteous staff. The high speed internet is really high speed and you have cable TV to unwind. The only downside is that the rooms are small ... but for a bsuiness traveller in my view it is sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in nasty weather”
Reviews.Author: jas044
Reviews.Content: Neither wind nor rain or a brutal combination of both will keep me from my appointed NYC trip and while the Holiday Inn Express was a little more out of the thick of things than I'm used to, it served the purpose quite well. The room, although compact, was perfect for one and as some others have posted, the TV has a bazillion channels. Usually, that doesn't matter, but given the fact that the weather Thursday the 10th was brutal and I was a tad under the weather, the range of channels was a nice surprise. The breakfast, although heavy on the sugar, was good, although the second morning it was so crowded I just grabbed a banana and a yogurt and scrammed. The 2 and 3 subway lines were three blocks away. My only complaint involves the shower, or more accurately, the shower curtain. The shower was an open stall and the curtain was too short to reach below the slight step-over. As a result, unless you directed the shower head towards the wall and didn't move, the floor directly outside the shower and near the toilet got pretty wet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DCTonyDC
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine on holiday invited me along to visit NY and despite being "away from the action," it was still very convenient since the 2 & 3 subway lines are a couple of blocks away. As other guests indicated, the rooms are small, but so are most hotel rooms in NY. The bed was amazingly comfortable and I fell asleep immediately, but was awakened by the roar of the in room heating unit. We too ended up turning it off. We did not explore the Seaport and arrived back to the room after midnight both Friday and Saturday night and was up about 8am and as a previous guest commented, the lady in charge of the continental breakfast was fantastic, cudos to her!! The housekeeping staff when encountered on the elevators were pleasant. While I did not foot the bill for this weekend since my friend is a Priority Club Member, I will consider staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal if you need a base near Wall Street - good value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: TheRealEngineer
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the other reviews I do wonder what some people expect for the money in one of the most expensive cities on earth! I spent 5 nights here with my teenage son in a 2 double bed room. Like most Manhattan hotels at the lower end of the price range (with en-suite) the rooms are not large but why on earth would you come to a city like this to spend time in the room? As a Holiday Inn Express the free breakfast is a welcome addition and helps save a few dollars for more "fun" things! The location is good for Wall Street, The South Street Port / Pier 17 and Battery Park. If you were planning to go to a lot of Broadway shows then you would probably want something closer to Times Square but the 2/3 Subway from Wall Street can get you there pretty quickly. The staff I had dealings with were pretty good (especially the one looking after the breakfast - didn't get her name unfortunately). We also managed to leave a couple of items in one of the desk drawers and when we called in two days later they were returned to us - so very happy about that. The only thing I would have liked was a safe in the room but other than that I was happy with the stay and as long as I can get the rate in the future (about $160 a night including the taxes) I would return again in he future.

Reviews.Title: “Ok room for the money.....”
Reviews.Author: jsdoc56TA
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in Wall street area about a block from South St. Seaport. Only 4 rooms per floor ...VERY small but adequate for a night's sleep.... TV remote didn't work and desk never brought new one. Ventilator VERY loud when it cycled at night so I shut it off. Housekeeping made TONS of noise early in the morning out in the hall. Glad it was only one night as a place to crash after a show.

Reviews.Title: “Staff truly does not care about guest well being.”
Reviews.Author: KA0702
Reviews.Content: While staying at this hotel I became very I'll and nearly incapacitated. My wife called front desk to ask them to check on me and response was a flat and repeated "NO". Fortunately I was able to dial 911 and get an ambulance. At no time during my stay did anyone acknowledge this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Walkabout2279
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. The whole staff was friendly and helpful. Comfortable, well designed rooms. Excellent cinnamon rolls at breakfast. Great location with lots of subway line choices in the neighborhood. Felt safe and quiet at night. Very clean compared to the two hi rated but smelly boutique hotels I checked out first.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Smurfyt
Reviews.Content: I read previous reviews about theft and I was worried about staying here. I went Thanksgiving long weekend and the staff was friendly despite it being a busy weekend. They even called a few hours after I checked in to see if everything was alright with the room and if we needed anything. The rooms were small but that can be expected in Manhattan. They were clean and we did not have anything stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mackado
Reviews.Content: We (me, the wife and 2 kids 12 & 8) spent the 2010 Thanksgiving holiday in NYC. If you are driving in prepare to pay for parking. There is a garage right behind the Express and they will give you a discount (not much, like $10). We were there for three days and it was $120. The room was very nice. The workers were friendly. Props go out to the awsome lady that works the breakfast bar. She was on the ball. She opened early on Thanksgiving day to feed us before we headed out to the parade. The room was clean and quiet. No street noise, elevator noise or sirens. There is a good deli a couple doors down and a coffee shop around the corner. The subway was around the corner as well. I would highly reccomend this palce.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable cozy convenient great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vacation201081
Reviews.Content: This was a quick small vacation, just to get away. This is a great place for a good price. It is somewhat far from uptown but close to the ferry for the statue of liberty & ellis island. I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Value - Temper Your Expectations”
Reviews.Author: dantman
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short....I was in NY for business and needed a clean modern hotel close to work - this hotel met all my requirements. It is a modern simple hotel with small rooms but with good facilities. The bed was outstanding, free internet (fast!) was great and great TV with endeless channel choices. Very little closet space - but hey, who neededs it ? I hund up my suit and 5 shirts and kept the rest in may case - no big deal unless you need to feel like you're at home with a full closet facility - not me though. The BIG downside is the airconditioning unit - they MUST address this - they have disabled the controls on the A/C and put in a wall unit panel - problem is there is only one speed for the fan and if you need the A/C on, it sounds like a jet engine - fortunately I could sleep without using it. I reported it to the hotel staff....but hey, it's a head office issue. The breakfast room is more than adequate if you want to grab a quick coffee and some toast - there is hot food too , but like I said in my headline, temper your expectations and you won't be disappointed - it's fast food personified, but adequate to fill an empty stomach - clean and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: NWBallardTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Holiday Inn Express, Wall Street using our accumulated hotel points. Check in was fine and we were given a room immediately at 12 Noon, much ahead of the check in time posted (4:00 pm). When we got to our room on the 7th floor we immediately noticed the carpeted floor directly in front of the bathroom was wet. So we notified the front desk and we were sent to a better room higher up in the building. I met with the housekeeping staff about the "wet floor room" and found out that because the building was so new the staff had maintenance issues with a number of the rooms. Most notably the ceramic soap holders in the tile showers were falling off! Even in our "better room" the soap holder was no longer in the shower. But, these are all small issues and the real value in this hotel is that it is clean and new. The breakfast offered is the same old Holiday Inn Express fare that a traveler finds in every single Holiday Inn Express. The staff at this hotel tries very hard to be helpful and they are sincere. If possible, get a room away from Water Street. The road and construction noise could be heard all night long. I am used to very busy street noise but some travelers would find this unacceptable. I will stay at this hotel again and loved the convenience to the subways. Also, the neighborhood is safe and there are enough conveniences nearby to make this a fairly good spot for an extended, moderately priced hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not even if someone paid me!”
Reviews.Author: beth931707
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice now, both times we checked in at midnight if not later so they had plenty of time to prepare the room for us. The first time we had no hot water & four out of the seven lights in our room were blown, when asked to fix the water the "engineer" who was actually the towel boy stole my engagement ring off the bathroom sink!! The second time we had a complimentary stay as the first was absolutely terrible, they put us up in the same room & this time I found blond hair on the bed & the floor (we're both redheads). Then to my absolute shock & disgust I found a pair of dirty mens UNDERWEAR underneath our bed!!!! I would not get within 20 feet of this place again even if someone paid me!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melody_2010
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned traveler, I have to say that this is one of the best basic hotels I've visited in the New York City area. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable and have all the basic amenities. Every member of the staff I met - from the front desk to housekeeping - was friendly, helpful and exceptionally professional. A problem with the lamps in my room was promptly addressed and my bill adjusted in my favor for the inconvenience. The Breakfast Bar deserves a review of its own. Full of fresh hot and cold items (including eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, muffins, yogurt, cereal, coffee, orange juice, apple juice and much more), makes this one of the best offerings I've seen in a complimentary breakfast. The bar and the dining area were spotless and inviting, and the attendant was friendly and always available to help the guests. As with most hotels, prices vary depending on when one books a room. I happened to require a room when the rates were a little higher than usual, but I still felt I received a good deal for my money. I enjoyed my stay at this centrally-located hotel and would gladly visit again. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great price”
Reviews.Author: Yann2002
Reviews.Content: Located really cloe to the metro line, the Holiday Inn Express is a really good place to stay. Breackfast being included in the room price make the price of the room a great deal (and the morning waitress is really nice and helpfull!) For a week-end in NY it is a great plca to stay because you're close to everything with the metro, but at walking distance from SouthStreet Seaport, a morning Sunday markt, Pier 17, Battery Park...

Reviews.Title: “a good handling of problems”
Reviews.Author: okurIstanbul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in mid-September and were very satisfied indeed. Actually, a power outage happened during our stay, making our TV set and Internet access unavaliable for a night, but the hotel handled the situation the following day and more importantly, they have compensated us for the temporary lack of these services at check-out. We are really thankful for their service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: suezinohio
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to NYC more than two dozen times and have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels every time. This was my first experience with a Holiday Inn property in Manhattan. I was not disappointed at all. Parking: parked around the corner for 30.00 a day with hotel stamping the parking ticket. Location: Great location if you want to be in Lower Manhattan. Walking distance to Wall Street, South Street Seaport, Ground Zero/Freedom Tower site, Brooklyn Bridge". Short walk to Chinatown and Little Italy. The hotel was very clean with a nice, smallish, lobby area. The staff was friendly. The room was large enough and comfortable for two people (my 16 yr old daughter and myself). The beds were comfortable and there was really no street noise. The only noise complaint I would have is that when people left their rooms, the doors slammed very loudly. Other than that, no complaints. The bathroom was clean and had ample amenities. There was a small business center with free internet service, which was nice as I forgot my laptop. The breakfast buffet was decent. Someone mentioned the watery eggs, which I'm sure were just powdered eggs, but they were kind of blah. The small omelettes were decent. Selection of bacon, breads, danishes, muffins, etc....My only complaint is that it was PACKED every morning. The poor guy trying to clean and restock the food really had his work cut out for him.... All in all, this was a nice hotel in a good, safe location and I would recommend if you want to make Lower Manhattan your hub of activity. I did miss being in Midtown, but it was a short subway ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel, Great service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: StephenJade
Reviews.Content: The Holiday inn Express in lower Manhattan is a newly built, clean, smart and smaller hotel. If I figured it out there are only 4 rooms per floor, but it is a high rise with many floors. It is conveniently located only blocks from the NYSE and Trinity church and the South Street sea port. The streets surrounding are busy during the week and very quite on the week end. Parking is garage parking a few blocks away or street parking with pay meters. Do read the signs if you plan on street parking. There are usually 3 or 4 signs, one over the other, all giving conflicting directions as to who and when you can park. Even after reading and adhering to them rigorously you may end up with a ticket. Parking enforcement in New York is merciless. The rooms are clean, new and well appointed. They are a normal size by New York standards. Just room for the bed and a desk. There was a nice flat screen and free high speed internet. The internet was wireless and it worked. Thank you. Many other hotels with wireless do not work as well. Staff at the front desk were knowledgeable and friendly. Engineering made a stop by to adjust the bed frame and that happened quickly. A major factor in our decision to book at this hotel was the location, the free internet and the inclusion of a buffet breakfast. The food was hot, fresh and quickly replenished. It included various eggs, toast, bagels, bacon, coffee /Tea, Juices, etc. It wasn’t missing anything, and a special thank you to Sonia, who was friendly and accommodating and kept the breakfast room humming. Check in and out was smooth and no long lines. I enjoyed my stay and will be back next year. Defiantly a place I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, brand new facility, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: chriskayTO
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only recently opened (July 2010) and it shows - everything is brand-spanking new. The decor is very non-descript modern, but functional -- this is a Holiday Inn Express, after all -- not the Park Plaza. The rooms are nicely furnished, but very tiny. This was not a problem for me or my travelling companions, however if you're looking for space to lounge, you will not find it here - the rooms had barely enough room for the bed, desk with chair, and tiny wardrobe. The washrooms are small, but not cramped, with only enough room for a shower - no tub. That said, the room was plenty comfortable with lots of light (26th floor facing east – I suspect the situation would be different on west-facing lower floors), the bed was very comfortable with nice linens and plenty of pillows. The television was a wall-mount LCD with tons of cable channels including on-demand viewing. The free wi-fi worked as expected. The staff were friendly, but still seem to be adapting to their routines, as check in and check out seemed to take longer than usual, and our keys mysteriously stopped working one day and had to be replayed. There are generally very few staff since this is a no-frills chain, and at night there's only a front desk attendant and security guard, so don't expect midnight room service call or extra pillows. Breakfast was decent considering there's no full kitchen - cereal, yogourt, fruit, hot eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, toast, coffee, juice - plenty to eat. The only downside is that on busy days the breakfast room was extremely cramped. The attendant was very friendly and handled her challenging juggling act with a smile. One other point to note - there is no service elevator at this hotel, so during the daytime hours you will be sharing lifts with housekeeping staff and carts. On my check-in day, I had to wait almost 10 minutes for an elevator, because they were being used by staff. Outside of business hours there were absolutely no issues using the elevators, as housekeeping staff are only in from 10am to 6pm. Considering the price we paid (I believe cheaper considering it was newly opened), I would recommend this hotel. It's clean, great location, and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: alismith74
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and I was a little skeptical since there were no photos...I paid 600 for 3 nights on labor day weekend. The hotel is new, the rooms are small but everything is smaller in NYC and they were very clean, there's a pier on fulton street thas has a small mall and bars and restaurants, that's only 3 blocks away, the free breakfast was good. I had no problems during my stay.I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: MikalaMarie
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: -Friendly, helpful staff. -Good-sized continental breakfast with helpful staff (although I don't recommend the watery eggs). -The rooms were really modern and nice. Remember, it's NYC, so expect the rooms to be "cozy" and only about half the size of a normal hotel room. -They accepted our bid on Priceline. We offered $120 a night. THE BAD: -We know we left our digital camera there and housekeeping "doesn't have it". We even offered a reward but it still hasn't surfaced. Sucky. -The elevators broke down (and we were on the 19th floor), but the staff fixed them quite quickly. -Coffee pots in restrooms = major turn off. Need to keep them on the nightstand or something! -No vending machines = not good news for hangovers. The water machine was broken in the lounge, too, so we had to go elsewhere for some agua. THE LOCATION: -This hotel is smack-dab in the middle of the financial district, so there's not much of a nightlife. -There is a convenient pharmacy only a block away. We didn't use it but it was nice to know it was there. -The only "nightlife" nearby is a fantastic restaurant/bar named Harry's Pizza Bar just a few blocks away that stays open until 3:30am (unless they're dead). They have an awesome pizza topped with hot sauce, french fries, and pepperoni that I highly recommend. The bar staff was super friendly and they played loud old school hip hop songs that we really enjoyed. They also have a large outdoor area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great service”
Reviews.Author: pandabear50
Reviews.Content: We had to move our college-age daughter into a nearby apartment and was glad to book a room here. The staff was very friendly and attentive, particularly the breakfast attendant, Sonia, who noted my need for a tray to take up coffee and muffins to the family, and would remember each morning as I came in. The room was always serviced pretty quickly. The only drawback was the double bed was a little short for my 5-11 husband whose feet was at the edge. Plus, parking is at a nearby garage, with a discount, but that's pretty typical for a Wall Street area hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very clean...”
Reviews.Author: dave42499
Reviews.Content: Nice room, very clean but really small, we had a king bed room, and it was small, the air conditioner works good, but its so close to the bed, it was cold. the breakfast is free and i was suprised, they have eggs bacon, sausage bagels, and never had to wait for a table, there also is a subway a few blocks away, and its walking distance to the south street seaport, all in all very happy with hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I paid that much for a closet??”
Reviews.Author: Nace0206
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in 4 star hotels when I travel to NYC, but this was a cheaper option so I decided to take my chances. Location was okay. I wasn't going to do any sightseeing, but if that's what you are traveling for, do not stay here. After checking in, I was literally put in a closet. The room was the size of the bed and the A/C unit was touching it. I could barely turn around in the bathroom. I called the front desk and asked to be moved to a handicapped accessible room, which was little bit larger than the first. At this point, it's 11:30 pm and I just wanted to lie down and relax when I realized my remote was missing and the tv wouldn't turn on without it. I called the front desk and he said he would look into it. 15 minutes later still no remote so I call him again and he says something about dealing with it later because he's busy helping someone else. So I just told him to forget about it. When I pulled back the comforter there were several sticky brown spots on the sheet. I was not about to wait for someone to change it so I ended up just putting the other sheet over it. The pillows smelled dirty and I woke up several times thinking about the sheets not being changed after the last person. The shower was weird. The elevator made awful noises that I hears all night. I was delighted to leave after the first night when I was supposed to stay 4.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travel_2k
Reviews.Content: the hotel just opened a few weeks ago - and it is clean as a new one. rooms are small, but this was expected. it is located @ Wall&Water St. with 2min walking distance to NYSE and 2/3 Subway station. for the price i paid = recommended

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the experience”
Reviews.Author: twowolves
Reviews.Content: This hotel is open.. I booked this hotel and I found it an enjoyable experience.. I travel often around both Canada and the US and would happily stay here again Room. First this is NYC.. so the rooms are small please do not judge them against hotels in other cities.. That said the room is new.. its all new.. there is not alot of storage area in the room but I made do with the small closet.. Everything was very clean and worked well including the TV with great cable.. The remote is a little annoying because you have to turn on both the tv and the cable but once you figure it out its fine.. (Need a sleep timer on it though).. The AC worked very well and although its rather loud keeps the room very cool. Gym... forget it.. Its very very small and unless you like just cardio a waste of time.. I got a week pass at the New York Sports Club one block away for 30 and worked out there.. Breakfast. It is free and is what you should expect.. the eggs I think are instant so I avoided them after the first day.. the juice is from concentrate but is fine.. I found the bananas past there prime but to be honest for a free breakfast it was fine.. Staff I found them all exceptionally helpful and pleasant.. always with a hello and smile on their faces.. Overall for the location I thought it was a great deal.. I would not book however directly from Holiday Inn. I booked through another site and got it at 2/3 the price they were quoting me..

Reviews.Title: “They charged me 800$ for a reservation that THEY cancelled”
Reviews.Author: Mplove84
Reviews.Content: Not only was the hotel not open for my stay and they advised me 3 days in advance, which is very helpfull in the high season, but I just received my credit card bill and they charged me $800. I have lost about 1 day making phone calls trying to find another place to stay, and it was horrible to try to find a place at the end of June two days before my stay. The Guest relations helped me a lot trying to find a solution, but not all of them were nice with me. One of the lady made me feel responsible and told me there was nothing she could do for me... come on. Worst attitude and worst guest service ever in my life. Now, it is my 4th time calling Guest Relations, loosing my time again, trying to get my money back for a reservation they had cancelled and replace by another one, and I have NO feedback, neither from the hotel nor Guest relations. That is how the company treats his guests? I had work for the chain for 3 years, and I could imagine to be treated this way with Holiday Inn. As I can we, we always have big surprise in life!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express New York City-Wall Street
HotelInfo.Address: 126 Water Street, New York City, NY 10005
